reviews.text:
As you arrive in Aomori by train Wa Rasse will be the first sightseeing place for you on the right side of Aomori train station. Nebuta floats that were used during the Nebuta festival in the previous years are placed here for you to see and why not, perform.
Give it a try! You will love it!
Come back in August to enjoy the festival! You will never forget it!

Stunning place, the collect yearly of the paper lamp that were used to celebrating in festival. Amazing art work, so you can study how it were made and the his story. This museum is just right in front if the station, in winter they also showing kids made paper lamp outside the museum. The museum itself is not that big bur it worth to visit.
This is an amazing place to be able to get up close and personal to see the Nebuta floats during the second half of the museum. Overall a quiet and nice museum.
This museum shows the excellent craftsmanship of Aomori people. It is worth going. They also simulate and teach you how they perform during the festival (drum, cymbals and dance steps).
Amazing place with great works of art. The floats are incredibly detailed. Also got to Play drums. Great place to come
I very much liked it. Big ship with interesting stuff to watch. Unfortunately very few English descriptions. And keep in mind that it is closed on Mondays.
This is an excellent museum but it is a shame most of it was in Japanese. But it was still interesting to walk through and see the inside workings of the ship, engine room and all
Good place to learn the history of local areas, and see the well made exhibition. (Japanese really required)
Great sight but a little further from the station during the snow season.
View is great, provide a good history of all previous inter island ferries.

Interesting museum showing the history and nature of Aomori. You can get general admission for 310 yen and it includes the 8 permanent exhibits. Exhibits include ancient culture, biology, wartime era, apples, and even an interactive room where you can play and try in clothing. The museum is very spacious and one can easily spend an hour or two here.
A small but we'll curated museum of natural history of Aomori region  as well as history of Aomori.
Nice place to spend time on.
Visit Hirosaki park during cherry blossom

営業時間が18時までと比較的遅くまで営業しているので、夕方の観光に利用しやすかったです。館内1階が企画展示で2階から3階が常設展示です。企画展示と常設展示を両方見ると、金額の大きな観覧料になります。企画展示はあっという間に見れてしまいますが、2階からの常設展示は沢山の展示がありました。全ての展示物をゆっくり見るには最低60分は必要だと思いました。

個人的に最も印象に残ったのが、順路後半にある民族展示室です。沢山の生活用具が展示されており、北国に生きた人達の生活の様子がよく分かりました☆また、考古展示室には遺跡から出土した土器や石器などが多く展示してあり、とても見応えありました。全体を通して、郷土館という名に相応しい展示内容で、大変勉強になりました(^^)

※常設展示の写真撮影は可能ですが、住所や名前を用紙に記入するように求められます。また、館内で撮影した画像をWEB上で公開するには許可申請が必要です。

Great place! Not very busy on New Years! 
They have goshuin ごしゅいん。also many luck charms!
so spiritual place. nice

Beautiful little shrine and gardens nestled in the center of Aomori. There are idyllic koi ponds here with bridges to little islands. You can buy fish food for ¥100 and feed the koi. There are also plenty of ducks and other birds hanging out too. Well worth a visit if you are in the area. Very good place to take photos.
You can be calm and feel peace here.
Very pleasant

Interesting museum showing the history and nature of Aomori. You can get general admission for 310 yen and it includes the 8 permanent exhibits. Exhibits include ancient culture, biology, wartime era, apples, and even an interactive room where you can play and try in clothing. The museum is very spacious and one can easily spend an hour or two here.
A small but we'll curated museum of natural history of Aomori region  as well as history of Aomori.
Nice place to spend time on.
Visit Hirosaki park during cherry blossom

Give it a try! You will love it!
Come back in August to enjoy the festival! You will never forget it!

Stunning place, the collect yearly of the paper lamp that were used to celebrating in festival. Amazing art work, so you can study how it were made and the his story. This museum is just right in front if the station, in winter they also showing kids made paper lamp outside the museum. The museum itself is not that big bur it worth to visit.
This is an amazing place to be able to get up close and personal to see the Nebuta floats during the second half of the museum. Overall a quiet and nice museum.
This museum shows the excellent craftsmanship of Aomori people. It is worth going. They also simulate and teach you how they perform during the festival (drum, cymbals and dance steps).
Amazing place with great works of art. The floats are incredibly detailed. Also got to Play drums. Great place to come

This hotel is 10-15mins walk away from the Aomori station. But it the entrance of the hotel is a bit secluded and hard to find.
The hotel provides a beautiful spa (not allowed to take photo), and breakfast as well.
The restaurant also provide dinner which has to be purchased at vending machine.
Reasonable price with various public baths though a little bit old fashioned

The room is very very tiny, but there’re perks: a great onsen (which also attracts a great many locals to visit), and a generous breakfast, it’s not exactly close to the JR rail station, but a 10 min walk is fair enough
This is a very good and convenient hotel!
Free onsen
Scallop specialised restaurant, but many other seafoods also available. You can try and catch scallop from the tank with pay. Enjoy and have fun.
Delicious Shell, Sashimi, Beer and enjoy in good price
Best place to enjoy callop

The shrimp is very small for its price. Fishing scallop is fun yet it taste so so given its fresh. 
The standard set are better.

Fishing for your own scallops is good fun though it's now got a 2 minute limit as where before it was 3.

It still costs 500 yen so it's not too bad .
The staff is one of the friendliest I've came across in aomori and even though on my first go i never caught a lot he chucked in an extra one.

I gave it another go and got better but he still gave me an extra scallop.

So twice I fished and I managed to nab myself ten scallops including the two he gave me for free.

You can have it sashimi or steamed so I went half half.

The scallops itself aren't the biggest in the world but they're fresh and sweet though it doesn't fill you up. Luckily they have a menu that offers lunch/dinner sets for a reasonable price.

A thousand yen for ten scallops in my book is a very fair price and even if you can't get that amount it's not a big price to pay for the experience..

Well worth going

安くて美味しい！
飲み放題付き3,000円のコースは、お料理もいっぱい出てきて、ボリューム満点！
とむや
飲み放題メニューも種類が豊富で、色々なお酒を試せたり、ノンアルメニューも多かったです
辛さも控えめで食べやすいし、テーブルにタバスコのようなソースもあったので、調整もできます
店員さんも感じ良かったです
居酒屋わやわやの姉妹店。熟成白神生ハムを売りにしている。単品699円テーブルサーブだと1000円。国産三元豚使用‼️添加物一切不使用‼️
3,500円のコースでお腹いっぱい食べられます。ただしハイボールは炭酸が抜けた感じでイマイチ

手軽にアジアン料理を食べられるお店です。
メニューが豊富で、何かしら好きなものにありつけます。
パクチー嫌いな人も楽しめます。
ただ、週末は予約しないと入れなさそうです。
飲み放題メニューも多く、料理のコスパも高い。平日の夜でも混んでいました。

Adorable little cafe... We went to this cafe twice for breakfast and had a very enjoyable time. The interior and the relaxed American classic music really sets the tone... Just like most Japanese cafe, the service was friendly... They have different menus for breakfast and lunch, they also have English menu... It's close to JAL city hotel, opens early for breakfast and affordable

Very satisfying breakfast with golden brown toast with butter and a decent cup of coffee.  Their iced chocolate was very nice too.

The shop was filled with locals and they had one English menu for foreigners.

Wonderful cafe in Aomori. We came here for breakfast two days in a row. Service is very friendly and they have an English menu. For ~500 yen, you can get a coffee, Thick Toast, boiled egg breakfast set that comes with jam (go for the famous Aomori Apple jam)!  Breakfast sausage was also tasty.

Atmosphere is very cute.  Wonderful place to relax.
Good service and good food, reasonable price.
Fun and traditional japanese coffee shop. Dessert was a killer

This hotel is 10-15mins walk away from the Aomori station. But it the entrance of the hotel is a bit secluded and hard to find.
The hotel provides a beautiful spa (not allowed to take photo), and breakfast as well.
The restaurant also provide dinner which has to be purchased at vending machine.
Reasonable price with various public baths though a little bit old fashioned

The room is very very tiny, but there’re perks: a great onsen (which also attracts a great many locals to visit), and a generous breakfast, it’s not exactly close to the JR rail station, but a 10 min walk is fair enough
This is a very good and convenient hotel!
Free onsen
